author: lightclient
content:
Do people have any outstanding concerns with the era1 format?

The latest two issues I've seen raised are:
1) snappy is not byte-for-byte identical for compression across impls, so you can't naively hash the compressed data to finger print -> no light-weight way to verify integrity of data. I am okay to accept this and if individual client teams want to release checksums for their era files, they may do that. We just wont have the expectation that they are all identical.
2) some clients can't process historical receipt format, so they can't produce era1 files -> also okay with this. We only need 1-2 impls of this get started.
